message: Thank you for useful information! Was looking for a guide on optimal timeouts for a long time.
Why on Windows 2008 (r2) on reading packet without valid structure (lenght prefix + data) system don't throw Out Of Memory exception and system will hangs? Is a way to avid this?

You should Close it and create a new one IMO. It *might* work to reuse the same instance, but AFAIK it's not guaranteed; the standard error handling response for any kind of error is to immediately Close the socket, and I would apply that same logic to the connecting socket.

This seems like a mandatory complement to the MSDN documentation. I have a question about SocketError.TimedOut. Can I then retry with the same Socket instance (using BeginConnect) or should I preferably Close it and create a new one?
